io.elegie.luchess.web.framework.presenting.freemarker

Class FreemarkerViewOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elegie.luchess.web.framework.presenting.freemarker.FreemarkerViewOptions

  • public class FreemarkerViewOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all possible options for a FTL view. As for now, these options are contained within the name of the view, but one could design other mechanisms if this simple approach would prove too simplistic.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String FTL_ATTACHMENT
      Attachment marker, to be included into the view name: "attachment".
      static java.lang.String FTL_NOCACHE
      No cache marker, to be included into the view name: "nocache" .

        public boolean isAttachment()
        Returns:
        True if the view should be sent back as an attachment.

        public boolean isNoCache()
        Returns:
        True if the view should not be cached.

      • createViewName

        public static java.lang.String createViewName(java.lang.String viewName,
                              FreemarkerContentTypes type)
        Creates a FTL view name with the provided name and type. By default, the view is not an attachment, and may be cached.
        Parameters:
        viewName - Name of the view.
        type - Type of the view.
        Returns:
        The FTL view name, with options embedded.

      • createViewName

        public static java.lang.String createViewName(java.lang.String viewName,
                              FreemarkerContentTypes type,
                              boolean isAttachment,
                              boolean isNoCache)
        Creates a FTL view name with the provided name, type, attachment and cache options.
        Parameters:
        viewName - Name of the view.
        type - Type of the view.
        isAttachment - Whether the view should be sent back as an attachment.
        isNoCache - Whether the view should not be cached (for GET methods).
        Returns:
        The FTL view name, with options embedded.
